note.p: Politician. BA, Oxford, 1836. Called to the bar, 1840. MP for Leominster, 1856–65; for Oxford University, 1865–78. President of the poor-law board, 1866–7; home secretary, 1867–8; secretary of state for war, 1874–8; secretary of state for India, 1878–80. Took the title Viscount Cranbrook of Hemsted and added Gathorne to his family name in 1878. Promoted to earl of Cranbook, 1892.
